title: Higher ping within the last 24 hours.

embed.description: I live in Colorado and get a pretty stable 36-38 ping. This morning when I jumped into a game after the patch though, I never dipped below 90,...

body: I usually run about 45 ping but since this morning i have been up to a solid 95. There are also other users experiencing this which makes me believe its not on our sides of the network. Here is a post about it.

replies.body: Its happening to me in Washington state as well. I had 60-62 ping until 2 days ago. Now its a solid 80-82 ping. Brought my computer to a different location and ping didnt change from 80-82. Any ideas on what is going on?

It's possible that your ISP may have changed how it routes to our servers, but there could be other network issues as well having trouble maintaining a strong connection to the game server.  As a first step, I suggest going over our [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to make sure that your network is in order.  Let me know if the issue persists, and we can dig deeper.

It's not necessarily a connection issue. My network is fine. The latency however has gone up a solid 50 ms. It is not budging from 95 as opposed to not budging from 44. It's just odd that some people across the country are experiencing this issue.

Porocles you gonna catch these hands if you keep blaming this crap on us, I normally run league at 31 ping with 350 fps, I'm running at 60/60 now. This is a joke. Nothing we have done is causing this. Our ISP have not changed routes to your servers, unless you have changed the way your servers receive them. You guys need to start being big boys accept responsibility and start working to resolve the issue.

If your FPS has been affected you need to check the sticky regarding disabling the Xbox recording service on your windows PC. It was turned on by default after a Windows update and locks you at 60 fps even with vsynch off.
